go_data.term: negative regulation of T cell activation
go_data.justification: CTLA-4 delivers a counterregulatory negative signal that antagonizes CD28 signals and thereby limits the magnitude and duration of T cell activation.
CTLA-4 is a negative regulator of T-lymphocyte activation.
CTLA-4 is a receptor for the B cell activation antigen B7.
CTLA-4 is a receptor for the B cell activation antigen B7.
